content.description:
Sands Through An Hourglass climbs sandy rock, but the movement really makes up for the poor rock quality.

Sit start with hands matched on the sidepull rail. From there, work right through a pair of right hand sidepulls to an edge, cross over with the left hand to a sidepull, release the toe/heel hook, collect your feet, work up the sidepull feature to a jug at the lip, and continue through the edges on the slab for the send.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. It traverses some ground near many rocks, but the entire time it climbs above a good, immediate fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Cucuy.

content.description:
Jungle Chimp is a low start to the existing

Jungle Pimp

, but weirdly didn't seem to share any moves.
content.location: Sit start on the sandy jug, move your left hand to a positive undercling, then move your right hand into the stand start hold. Move out left to a small edge, then make a quick hop to a jug, and top out.

content.description:
Jungle Pimp is a gymnastic-styled climb that ascends a sharply featured overhang above a good landing.

Stand start with hands matched in the shallow hueco, a left foot pasted high out left, and the right foot  hanging.  From there, stick a left hand crimp (crux), then dyno to a right hand jug (crux), campus up the jugs at the lip, throw a left heel, and top it out using the bumps.
content.protection: A few pads will work.  The landing is good, but there is a rock out right that may come into play during the dyno.
content.location: It ascends the south face of Cucuy Rock.
